basics.name: Riadh Fezzani
basics.label: Doctor in applied mathematics
basics.summary:
Autonomous and curious, 8 years of experience including a
                	Ph.D., I appreciate multidisciplinary environments and the
                	implementation of efficient algorithms.

work.summary:
I actually work in the R&D departement of **Océ - A Canon compagny**,
                within the **Eiger project** (2.5 and 3D high resolution printing). My
  		mission consists in developping multiple tools for the vizualisation
  		and the manipulation of digital 3D objects. I participated to the
                filling of Three patents.

Within the **SPIM** team in
		the _laboratoire Charles Fabry_, I worked in the context of
		the **Reveal** project in close collaboration with the
		**iMove** team at **ONERA**, the **Institut de la Vision** and
                **Imagine Eyes** on the design of efficient
		algorithms for the processing of eye fundus images aquired with an
		adaptive optics camera
highlights: Fast image registration under rigid and non-rigid motion hypothesis
Acquisition area detection via mutual information maximization
Blood vessel activity detection using residual motion estimation

work.summary:
Within the **PARALL** team
			in the laboratoire de recherche en informatique **LRI**, I
			worked in the context of the **PetalH** project on the design
			of new parallel preconditioners made for the acceleration of the
			resolution of large ill-conditioned sparse linear systems
highlights: approximate block LDU factorization with filtering constraints

work.summary:
In the Hight performance computing team (**DTIM/CHP**), 'Parallel
		approach for optical flow estimation by variational method'(Advisors:
                Frédéric _Champagnat_ and François-Xavier _Roux_).

In the parallel algorithms team, in collaboration with The innovative
		Computing Laboratory (**ICL**) from the university of
		Tennessee: 'Study of the parallelization of the $LDL^T$
		factorization in the symmetric indefinite case' (Advisor: Marc _Baboulin_)
